tatami.simulation

Class AgentCreationData

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.simulation.AgentCreationData

  • public class AgentCreationData
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing the data for the creation of an agent.

    Some data (agentName and platform) is covered by the enclosed AgentParameters instance, but it is also added separately so as to guarantee is availability.

    Most of the information available otherwise is also covered by the enclosed XMLTree.XMLNode reference. The node may however contain additional information. Loaders not needing (or not handling) this information may never use it.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Constructor Detail

      • AgentCreationData

        public AgentCreationData(java.lang.String name,
                 AgentParameters agentParameters,
                 java.lang.String destination,
                 boolean remote,
                 java.lang.String agentPlatform,
                 AgentLoader agentLoader,
                 net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode scenarioNode)
        Creates a new instance of information for the creation of an agent.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the agent.
        agentParameters - - the AgentParameters instance to pass to the agent.
        destination - - the container on which the agent should be created.
        remote - - true if the container is remote (not on the local machine); false otherwise.
        agentPlatform - - the platform on which the agent will execute.
        agentLoader - - the AgentLoader instance to use for loading the agent.
        scenarioNode - - the XMLTree.XMLNode instance corresponding to the agent, as resulted from parsing the scenario file.

        Returns:

      • isRemote

        public boolean isRemote()
        Returns:
        true if the agent should be created on the local machine, false if it should be created on a different machine.

      • getDestinationContainer

        public java.lang.String getDestinationContainer()
        Returns:
        the name of the container in which the agent should be created.

      • getPlatform

        public java.lang.String getPlatform()

        the name of the platform that this agent will execute on.

      • getAgentLoader

      • getNode

        public net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode getNode()
        Returns:
